CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 25, 1954, pg. 2, reads: "City's Oldest Resident's Birthday - Mrs. Sabra Washington, who is known fondly by her neighbors as 'Mother' Washington, celebrated her birthday Monday. She figures she's about 109.  Friends and neighbors held their annual affair for her at her home on Conemaugh Street where she lives with her nephew, Lee McDuffie.  Among those at her party were Mrs. Annie Cypress, Mrs. Mary Williams, Arthur Johnson, Mrs. Alice Taylor, Lee McDuffie, and Earsley Kincaid and Lee Dorris of radio Station WILY. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington seated with cake on lap on her 109th birthday, surrounded by Annie Cypress, Mary Williams, Arthur Johnson, Alice Taylor, Lee McDuffie, Earsley Kincaid, and Lee Dorris, posed in Washington home on Conemaugh Street
